snippet: Believing a cease-fire was in effect for the visit of Egypt’s prime minister, a man left his home to buy cooking gas and was killed in a blast.
abstract: Gaza residents Abed Abu Wardah and his four-year-old neighbor Mahmoud Sadallah are killed in an explosion after leaving their homes under the impression that bombings had been halted; explosion, along with other attacks, brings a quick end to a temporary cease-fire that had been declared to accommodate the visit of Egyptian Prime Min Hesham Qandil.

byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and FARES AKRAM

lead_paragraph: Believing a cease-fire was in effect for the visit of Egypt’s prime minister, a man left his home to buy cooking gas and was killed in a blast.

headline.seo: In Gaza, Tragic Result for Misplaced Hopes of Cease-Fire
headline.main: Mistaken Lull, Simple Errand, Death in Gaza
headline.print_headline: Mistaken Lull, Simple Errand, Death in Gaza
